title: The Best Ways to Make AirPods Stay in Your Ears

steps.title: Wipe the speakers of the AirPods with a slightly dampened cloth.
steps.content: Wipe the speakers of the AirPods with a slightly dampened cloth. Take a clean cloth or paper towel and lightly dampen it with cool water. Wipe away any oil, dirt, or residue from the tips of the AirPods, where the speaker ports are. Rub away any stuck-on residue so they’re clean. [1] X Research source Oil and dirt can affect how well the AirPods can adhere to your ears.

steps.title: Press the AirPods in your ears with the stem pointing down.
steps.content: Press the AirPods in your ears with the stem pointing down. Gently press the AirPods in your ears so the speakers are facing into your ear canal. Point the stem of the AirPods down so they’re aligned vertically with your head. Don’t force the AirPods deep into your ear canal.

steps.title: Rotate the AirPods so the stem is sticking out of your ears horizontally.
steps.content: Rotate the AirPods so the stem is sticking out of your ears horizontally. Take 1 AirPod by the stem and twist it upward so the speaker portion is wedged into your ear canal. Continue twisting until the stem is sticking out of your ear and is aligned horizontally with your head. Then, repeat the process with the AirPod in your other ear. Wedging the AirPods in your ear canal will help hold them in place and keep them from falling out. If you have a habit of losing your AirPods , you can add them to Find My. This way, you'll be able to track them down whether they're lost, stolen, or out of battery.

steps.title: Choose waterproof tape to tape your AirPods.
steps.content: Choose waterproof tape to tape your AirPods. Waterproof tape has an adhesive side for you to attach it to your AirPods and the non-sticky side won’t slip and slide in your ear. Pick up a roll of waterproof tape from a home improvement store or department store near you, or search for some online. Don’t use duct tape or scotch tape, which won’t provide as much grip and will leave behind a sticky residue on your AirPods.

steps.title: Use a hole punch to cut out 4 circles of waterproof tape.
steps.content: Use a hole punch to cut out 4 circles of waterproof tape. Take a standard hole punch and insert a small strip of the waterproof tape into the punch slot. Press down on the hole punch to remove a small circle from the strip of tape. Punch out 4 small circles and set them aside. Wipe the hole punch clean with a damp cloth to remove the sticky residue.

steps.title: Place a piece of tape above and below the speaker on each AirPod.
steps.content: Place a piece of tape above and below the speaker on each AirPod. Attach 2 circles of tape to each AirPod, placing 1 above the opening for the speaker and 1 below it, where the AirPod touches the skin of your ear. Make sure the 2 circles of tape are installed in the same locations on each AirPod. The small pieces of tape won’t prevent you from being able to store the AirPods in their case.

steps.title: Put the AirPods in your ears with the stem pointing down.
steps.content: Put the AirPods in your ears with the stem pointing down. Press the AirPods into your ears so the speakers are pointed toward your ear canal. Make sure the stem of the AirPods are pointed down and lined up vertically with your jaw. The tape will provide extra grip to help keep the AirPods from falling out.

steps.title: Fit a cover with ear hooks over your AirPods for extra stability.
steps.content: Fit a cover with ear hooks over your AirPods for extra stability. Use covers with earhooks that are designed for AirPods and slide your AirPods into them so they’re snug and secure. Make sure the openings on the covers line up with the speaker openings on the AirPods. Fit the AirPods into your ear canal and slip the hooks over your ears so they’re held in place and won’t fall out . Visit an iPhone accessory store or search online for covers with ear hooks for your AirPods. Covers with ear hooks are great for keeping your AirPods from falling out during physical activity such as running or cycling.

steps.title: Connect silicone ear tips to create a tighter seal on your ear.
steps.content: Connect silicone ear tips to create a tighter seal on your ear. Use silicone ear tips designed for AirPods and fit them over the speaker portion of each of the AirPods. Line up the speakers with the openings on the ear tips so the music won’t be muffled. Put the AirPods into your ears so the silicone is wedged into your ear canal, creating a tight seal that will keep them from falling out easily. You can find silicone tips at iPhone accessory stores and online. The seal created by the silicone tips will also block out more background noise and make your music sound louder.

steps.title: Slip foam earphone covers over the AirPods to improve their fit.
steps.content: Slip foam earphone covers over the AirPods to improve their fit. Take fuzzy foam earphone covers and slide them over the speaker portion of each of your AirPods. Put your AirPods in your ears with the stem pointing down so the foam material and thickness of the covers will keep them from slipping out. You can find ear covers online. Foam earphone covers will improve the bass quality of the AirPods as well.

steps.title: Use ear warmers or sweatbands to hold the AirPods in.
steps.content: Use ear warmers or sweatbands to hold the AirPods in. This can be especially helpful if you're using your AirPods in cold weather. The ear warmers or sweatbands can physically hold them in place while you walk, run, or exercise. You could also use a beanie pulled down to your ears for a more casual look.
